page.title: 03CHANGING TIMES
page.content: In 1915 life was quite different because of the fact that there was no electricity and no water system so everyone would have to go to the a well but in the summer the wells would dry up and they would have to go to the local pond or stream.probaly the most noticable change in Dallington is the opening of the new school in 1915.The new school was opened because it could not take such large numbers of children.There has only been one major accident in the village between 1915-1985 and that was when a horse and cart was traveling down Prinkle hill layden with stones.The driver tried to stop the horse.The horse stopped but the cart kept on going and he fell off and got caught in the wheel and was draged to the bottom and was killed.
